clinical_study.brief_title: Exact Localisation of Impacted and Supernumerary Teeth by Cone Beam Computer Tomography
clinical_study.official_title: Exact Three-dimensional Localisation of Impacted and Supernumerary Teeth by Cone Beam Computer Tomography

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this investigation is an exact preoperative 3D-localisation of impacted and supernumerary teeth in the maxilla using Cone Beam Computer Tomography

detailed_description.textblock:
An exact localisation of impacted teeth is often difficult to assume by using conventional radiological techniques like OPT or dental films. In contrast to these two-dimensional imaging methods the Cone Beam Computer Tomography (CBCT) respectively the Digital Volume Tomography (DVT) offers a three-dimensional imaging of the maxillofacial region, providing the opportunity to study objectives in all standard plans with 3D-reconstruction in multisection views.
A preoperative radiological investigation using CBCT on patients who are supposed to undergo surgery for impacted and supernumerary teeth in the frontal maxilla shall clarify the certainty and safeness of this 3D-imaging method. Therefore a comparison between the findings on the CBCT, on eventually former conventional x-rays and the intraoperative finding as gold standard is done.

primary_outcome.description: Cone Beam Computer Tomography, vs gold standard intraoperative finding

arm_group.description: three-dimensional digital imaging using cone beam tomography (CBCT)

intervention.description: Cone Beam Computer Tomography. 3D-imaging Digital Volume Tomography, compared with gold standard intraoperative findings.

study_pop.textblock: All patients at the St.Olavs University Hospital with impacted and supernummerary teeth in the maxilla who are scheduled to have surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- supernumerary and impacted teeth in the maxilla (wisdom teeth excluded)
- need for surgical removement
- uncertain clinical and conventional radiological finding
Exclusion Criteria:
- refused approval
- CBCT not practicable
